BIOPAC Hardware API FAQ

  • How do you use the Hardware API in [programming language "X"]?
  • Will I lose data if I process it in between calls to receiveMPData()?
  • I am using an MP150/MP160/MP200 and the call to connectMPDev() keeps returning MPNOTINET. What should I do?
  • What are the numerical values of the enum values MPCOMERR, MPUSB, MPUDP, MP150, MP160, MP200, MP36, MP36AR and MPNOTINNET?
  • How do I configure an Analog Input Channel's scaling, filters and gain settings?

How do you use the Hardware API in [programming language "X"]?

Incorporating external APIs is specific to the programming language. Generally, if the programming language can produce software programs for the Windows Platform it can call functions from any generic DLL. In addition, the process of invoking functions from DLLs is referred to differently by different programming languages. Please consult the documentation for your particular programming language.

Click the Sample Programs button on the top to learn about programs utilizing the Hardware API written in various programming languages.

Will I lose data if I process it in between calls to receiveMPData()?

The function receiveMPData() receives data from a dedicated thread that downloads data from the MP device. This thread is created when the function startMPAcqDaemon() is called. As soon as the acquisition is started with a call to startAcquisition(), the thread begins to download data from the MP device and writes the data stream in an internal TCP socket. Every time receiveMPData() is called it reads the data from a corresponding internal TCP socket.

TCP is guaranteed to be a loseless form of communication. Therefore, data will not be lost if you decide to process data in between calls to receiveMPData().

Please keep in mind that the Hardware API utilizes the operating system's TCP stack. Long intervals between calls to receiveMPData() may cause it to fail, especially at high sampling rates or multiple acquisition channels.

I am using an MP150/MP160/MP200 and the call to connectMPDev() keeps returning MPNOTINET. What should I do?

First, make sure you can communicate to the MP150/MP160/MP200 using AcqKnowledge.

If connectMPDev() returns MPNOTINET, you can try using "AUTO" or "auto" as the serial number parameter of the connectMPDev() function.

If that does not work, make sure that the serial number you provided is exactly the same as the serial number that appears on the serial number label on the top of the MP150/MP160/MP200 you want to use. The serial number will be similar to 308A-0000393. In AcqKnowledge software, only the last seven characters appear, 0000393.

If this fails, please make sure the your MP150/MP160/MP200 is using the latest firmware. Please consult your AcqKnowledge documentation or the BIOPAC website to update MP150/MP160 firmware.

What are the numerical values of the enum values MPCOMERR, MPUSB, MPUDP, MP150, MP160, MP200, MP36, MP36AR and MPNOTINNET?

MPCOMERR, MPUSB, MPUDP, MP150, MP160, MP200, MP36, MP36A and MPNOTINNET are enumeration values. Enumeration (enum) values is a sequence of constant values. The first enum value would start at zero and subsequent values would represent the subsequent integer value. If an enum value is defined, subsequent enum values will have the subsequent integer value.

Based on this and the Hardware API's documentation:

  • MPCOMERR is 11
  • MP150 is 101
  • MP36 is 102
  • MP160 is 103
  • MP200 is 104
  • MP36A is 105
  • MPUSB is 10
  • MPUDP is 11
  • MPNOTINNET is 16

How do I configure an Analog Input Channel's scaling, filters and gain settings?

You can configure these settings using the setAnalogChScale(), loadXMLPresetFile() and configChannelByPresetID() functions. Please read Channel Presets XML File.
